snippet: “They may appear cuddly and romantic, but foxes are also a pest and a menace,” Mayor Boris Johnson said. Some in London, however, are working to save the animals from harm.
abstract: London Journal; Great Britain has the world's highest known density of urban foxes, and there are now more foxes in London than double-decker buses; schools, farms and families with small children and pets hire 'fox snipers' to kill them but subject is controversial; country has world's longest tradition of animal rights, and many in London are working to save the animals from harm.
lead_paragraph: “They may appear cuddly and romantic, but foxes are also a pest and a menace,” Mayor Boris Johnson said. Some in London, however, are working to save the animals from harm.

headline.main: Forget the Hounds. As Foxes Creep In, Britons Call the Sniper.
headline.print_headline: Forget the Hounds. As Foxes Creep in, Britons Call the Sniper.

keywords.value: Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals
